data.value: Save the image, and then close it.

data.name: CloudsEffect.ConfigDialog.UsageLabel
data.value: To change the color that the clouds are drawn in, you can set the primary and secondary colors in the Colors window.

data.name: ColorPalette.SaveHeader
data.value: ; Paint.NET Palette File ; Lines that start with a semicolon are comments ; Colors are written as 8-digit hexadecimal numbers: aarrggbb ; For example, this would specify green: FF00FF00 ; The alpha ('aa') value specifies how transparent a color is. FF is fully opaque, 00 is fully transparent. ; A palette must consist of ninety six (96) colors. If there are less than this, the remaining color ; slots will be set to white (FFFFFFFF). If there are more, then the remaining colors will be ignored.
data.comment: Yes, this should be translated. This is written to the beginning of palette files, which are stored in text files (*.txt). They are intended to be understandable by the user.

data.name: ColorPalettes.UserDataSubDirName
data.comment: This is a directory that will be created in the directory that SystemLayer.UserDataDirName refers to.

data.name: ColorPickerTool.HelpText
data.value: Left click to set primary color, right click to set secondary color

data.name: ControlShadow.BetaTag.Text.Format
data.value: This is a pre-release version, and is recommended for testing purposes only. Expires on {1}. An update will be available before then. www.biosensors.be
data.comment: {0} is the full application name, e.g. "SIS v3.0 (Beta 1 Release build 3.0.2460.34921). {1} is a date string.

data.name: SetupWizard.CancelDialog.Message
data.value: The installation is not yet complete. Are you sure you want to exit?

data.name: SetupWizard.CreateMsiPage.IntroText.Text.Finished
data.value: The MSI packages have been placed into the following directory: '{0}'.

data.name: SetupWizard.Error.AdminRequired
data.value: Administrator privilege is required to install Paint.NET.

data.name: SetupWizard.HelpText
data.value:
Paint.NET Installer Help
Command-line options:
/skipConfig - Skips configuration of options and install directory. Uses MSI properties in the following order of precedence: 1. supplied on command-line, 2. read from HKLM\Software\Paint.NET, 3. default values. NOTE: Use of this option infers acceptance of the License Agreement. /auto - Automatic install. Infers /skipConfig. Does not show the final wizard page that details the result of installation. /createMsi - Creates MSI packages that may be used for deployment (AD/GPO) purposes. All properties specified on the command-line are merged into the MSI packages, so no further transforms are necessary. PROPERTY=VALUE - Sets an MSI property. See help file after installing for more information. You do not need to specify /saveMsi to specify properties.
Return code is 0 on success, or non-zero on failure.

data.name: SetupWizard.InstallDirPage.BadDirError.Message
data.value: The specified folder could not be created. You will need to choose another folder to install to.

data.name: SetupWizard.InstallDirPage.IntroText.Text.Format
data.value:
The installer will install {0} to the following folder.
To install in this folder, click "Next". To install to a different folder, enter it below or click "Browse".

data.name: SetupWizard.InstallingPage.InfoText.Text.Failure.Format
data.value: There was an error while installing {0}.

data.name: SetupWizard.InstallingPage.InfoText.Text.Optimizing
data.value: Optimizing performance for your system. This may take a minute.

data.name: SetupWizard.InstallingPage.InfoText.Text.Success.Format
data.value: {0} was installed successfully. Click "Finish" to close this installation wizard.

data.name: SetupWizard.InstallingPage.InfoText.Text.Success.RebootRequired.Format
data.value: {0} was installed successfully. A reboot may be required to use it properly. Click "Finish" to close this installation wizard.

data.name: SetupWizard.InstallingPage.PdnDonateBannerImage.Text
data.value: Thanks for using Paint.NET. You can show your appreciation and support future development by donating!

data.name: SetupWizard.IntroPage.CustomDescription.Text
data.value: Allows you to change the installation directory, and options related to file type associations and update checking.

data.name: SetupWizard.IntroPage.ExpirationWarning.Format
data.value: NOTE: This is a pre-release version of Paint.NET that will expire on {0}.
data.comment: {0} is a date.

data.name: SetupWizard.IntroPage.IntroText.Text.Format
data.value:
This installer will help you install {0}.
Choose the installation method you prefer, and then click Next.
data.comment: {0} is the product name.

data.name: SetupWizard.IntroPage.QuickDescription.Text
data.value: This is the recommended choice for most users. This installs using the default options, or the same options that were specified during a previous installation.

data.name: SetupWizard.LicensePage.IntroText.Text
data.value: Please take a moment to read the license agreement now. If you accept the terms below, click "I Agree", then "Next". Otherwise click "Cancel".

data.name: SetupWizard.OptionsPage.DesktopShortcutCheckBox.Text
data.value: Create a shortcut on the Desktop

data.name: SetupWizard.OptionsPage.JpgPngBmpCheckBox.Text
data.value: Use it as the default image editor for JPEG, PNG, and BMP images

data.name: SetupWizard.OptionsPage.LaunchHandlingText.Text
data.value: Use these options to configure how Paint.NET can be launched.

data.name: SetupWizard.OptionsPage.TgaCheckBox.Text
data.value: Use it as the default image editor for TGA images

data.name: SetupWizard.OptionsPage.UpdatesText.Text
data.value: Paint.NET can periodically check to see if there is a new version available and then notify you. No information is transmitted from your computer during this process. Note: You will only be notified of new versions while Paint.NET is running.

data.name: SetupWizard.ReadyToInstallPage.IntroText.Text.Format
data.value:
The installer is ready to install {0} on your computer.
Click "Next" to start the installation.

data.name: SetupWizard.x86Msi.LaunchCondition.NotAllowedOn64bitOS
data.value: 32-bit MSI may not be installed on 64-bit OS.

data.name: Startup.UnhandledError.Format
data.value: There was an unhandled error, and Spectroscopy Imaging Suite must be closed. Refer to the file '{0}', which has been placed on your desktop, for more information.
data.comment: {0} is a filename

data.name: StatusBar.Context.Help.Text.Format
data.comment: {0} is the tool's name, {1} is its help text

data.name: StatusBar.Context.SelectedArea.Text.Format
data.value: Selection top left: {0}{1}, {2}{3}. Bounding rectangle size: {4}{5} x {6}{7}. Area: {8} {9} square
data.comment: {0} is an X coordinate, {1} is units abbreviation, {2} is Y coordinate, {3} is units abbreviation, {4} is width, {5} is units abbreviation, {6} is height, {7} is units abbreviation, {8} is the area, {9} is plural units (pixels, inches)

data.name: StatusBar.Context.SelectedArea.Text.WithAngle.Format
data.value: Selection top left: {0}{1}, {2}{3}. Bounding rectangle size: {4}{5} x {6}{7}. Area: {8} {9} square. Angle: {10}°
data.comment: {0} is an X coordinate, {1} is units abbreviation, {2} is Y coordinate, {3} is units abbreviation, {4} is width, {5} is units abbreviation, {6} is height, {7} is units abbreviation, {8} is the area, {9} is plural units (pixels, inches), {10} is angle of rotation

data.name: StatusBar.CursorInfo.Format
data.comment: {0} is x offset, {1} is units, {2} is y offset, {3} is units

data.name: StatusBar.Progress.Percentage.Format
data.comment: {0} is an integer

data.name: StatusBar.Size.Format
data.comment: {0} is width, {1} is units (e.g. cm or px), {2} is height, {3} is units

There was an error while checking for updates.

data.value: Automatically check for newer versions of Paint.NET

data.name: WarnAboutFlattening.Text
data.value: Saving in this file format will "flatten" the image, discarding all layering information and hidden layers. Proceed?

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.ConnectFailure
data.value: The remote service point could not be contacted at the transport level.
data.comment: All of the WebExceptionStatus.* strings are copied straight from MSDN's documentation (except where explicitely noted), http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/cpref/html/frlrfsystemnetwebexceptionstatusclasstopic.asp

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.KeepAliveFailure
data.value: The connection for a request that specifies the keep-alive header was closed unexpectedly.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.MessageLengthLimitExceeded
data.value: A message was received that exceeded the specified limit when sending a request or receiving a response from the server.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.NameResolutionFailure
data.value: The name resolver service could not resolve the host name.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.Pending
data.value: An internal asynchronous request is pending.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.PipelineFailure
data.comment: This text is different than what is in the MSDN documentation.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.ProtocolError
data.value: The response received from the server was complete but indicated a protocol-level error. For example, an HTTP protocol error such as 401 Access Denied would use this status.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.ProtocolError.Format
data.value: The server returned the following error code: HTTP {1} ({0})
data.comment: {0} is a string name from the System.Net.HttpStatusCode enumeration. {1} is an integer, such as 404

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.ProxyNameResolutionFailure
data.value: The name resolver service could not resolve the proxy host name.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.ReceiveFailure
data.value: A complete response was not received from the remote server.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.RequestCanceled
data.comment: This text is different than what is in the MSDN documentation.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.SecureChannelFailure
data.value: An error occurred while establishing a connection using SSL.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.SendFailure
data.value: A complete request could not be sent to the remote server.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.ServerProtocolViolation
data.value: The server response was not a valid HTTP response.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.Timeout
data.value: No response was received during the time-out period for a request.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.TrustFailure
data.value: A server certificate could not be validated.

data.name: WebExceptionStatus.UnknownError
data.value: An exception of unknown type has occurred.

data.name: WIA.Error.EnableMe
data.value: To use this feature you must enable the Windows Image Acquisition system service.

data.name: WIA.Error.UnableToLoad
data.value: The Windows Image Acquisition (WIA) library, "wiaaut.dll" is unavailable. Please read the Help file (Help menu -> Help Topics), in the Frequently Asked Questions topic, for troubleshooting information.

data.name: ZoomConfigWidget.Error.TooSmall
data.value: Zoom has to be at least 1%

data.name: ZoomConfigWidget.Percentage.Format
data.comment: {0} is an integer

data.name: ZoomTool.HelpText
data.value: Left click to zoom in, right click to zoom out, middle click to slide

data.name: Startup.MDIwarning
data.value: "WARNING! This software is designed to support multiple documents at the same time (MDI). However, full support for this is not yet implemented so DON'T try it! Always close a document before opening another.
